ground_truth: A disheveled young man in a gaily colored Hawaiian shirt is launched into frame by someone offscreen, as the hatch marks on the wall behind him are apparently height markers. His picture is taken, and it is mounted on a tripod. A pretty young woman in a severe police uniform peers out from behind it. HI obliges but still looks at Ed out of the corner of his eye, on his eye-skewed profile, as Hi is escorted away from the camera toward his cell. At the far end of the corridor, a huge con is sluggishly mopping the floor, and the Mopping Con snarls as Hi passes. Panning a circle of men who sit facing each other in folding chairs, the pan starts on Hi. At this point, the pan has reached the COUNSELOR, an earnest, bearded young man who straddles a folding chair with his arms folded over its back; he is addressing one of the Cons. The huge muscle-bound black man with a shaved head is knitting his brow in consternation. Three PAROLE OFFICERS - two men and a woman - face Hi across a table. A beat-up Chevy pulls into the all-night store's empty parking lot, and Hi is getting out of the Chevy in a Hawaiian shirt, holding a pump-action shotgun. He primes the shotgun - WHOOSH - CLACK - and heads for the store. Full-face exposure of Hi once again in front of the mug-shot wall. Hi obliges but shoots sympathetic glances at Ed who is obviously upset, wiping away tears and snuffling behind the camera, on Hi's profile. He turns back to Ed, looking up through her tears as Hi is led away, as another police officer starts to lead him away, struggling to call back over his shoulder as he is firmly led out the door. The door slams, as Hi is once again escorted toward his cell. The Mopping Con is now in the middle-background, having worked his way about halfway up the corridor since last time we saw him as Hi passes, and Hi looks sheepish. Two convicts sitting next to each other, GALE and EVELLE, appear to be friends. Hi faces the same three PAROLE OFFICERS across the same table. Of a 7-Eleven parking lot, at night, deserted except for Hi's car which sits untended, its engine rumbling, Hi backpedals into frame with a shotgun and a bag of cash. He spins and grabs his car-door handle, locked. He tries the back door, locked. As we hear the wail of an approaching siren, Hi takes it on the heel and toe. On Hi against the mug-shot wall, we see his right hand being efficiently manipulated by Ed's two hands: She is rolling each of his inked fingers into the appropriate space on an exemplar sheet.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: A rumpled youthful male in a brightly hued Hawaiian shirt is propelled into view by somebody offscreen, as the hatch markings on the partition behind him are evidently altitude indicators. His image is captured, and it is mounted on a tripod. A beautiful youthful female in a strict police attire peers out from behind it. HI complies but still glances at Ed out of the corner of his eye, on his eye-skewed profile, as Hi is escorted away from the camera toward his cell. At the far end of the passageway, a gigantic inmate is sluggishly mopping the ground, and the Mopping Inmate snarls as Hi passes. Panning a circle of men who sit facing one another in folding chairs, the pan begins on Hi. At this juncture, the pan has reached the COUNSELOR, a sincere, bearded youthful male who straddles a folding chair with his arms folded over its back; he is addressing one of the Inmates. The large muscle-bound dark-skinned male with a shaved head is furrowing his brow in perplexity. Three PAROLE OFFICERS - two males and a female - face Hi across a table. A battered Chevy pulls into the all-night shop's vacant parking lot, and Hi is exiting the Chevy in a Hawaiian shirt, holding a pump-action shotgun. He primes the shotgun - WHOOSH - CLACK - and heads for the shop. Full-face portrayal of Hi once again in front of the mug-shot partition. Hi complies but shoots empathetic glances at Ed who is obviously distressed, wiping away tears and snuffling behind the camera, on Hi's profile. He turns back to Ed, looking up through her tears as Hi is led away, as another police officer starts to escort him away, struggling to call back over his shoulder as he is firmly led out the door. The door slams, as Hi is once again escorted toward his cell. The Mopping Inmate is now in the middle-background, having worked his way about halfway up the passageway since last time we saw him as Hi passes, and Hi looks sheepish. Two inmates sitting next to one another, GALE and EVELLE, appear to be companions. Hi faces the same three PAROLE OFFICERS across the same table. Of a 7-Eleven parking lot, at night, deserted except for Hi's vehicle which sits untended, its engine rumbling, Hi retreats into view with a shotgun and a bag of cash. He spins and grabs his car-door handle, locked. He tries the rear door, locked. As we hear the wail of an approaching siren, Hi takes it on the heel and toe. On Hi against the mug-shot partition, we see his right hand being efficiently manipulated by Ed's two hands: She is rolling each of his inked fingers into the appropriate space on an exemplar sheet.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: A disheveled young man in a gaily colored Hawaiian shirt is launched into frame by someone offscreen, as the hatch marks on the wall behind him are apparently height markers. Someone takes his picture, and it is mounted on a tripod by them. A pretty young woman in a severe police uniform peers out from behind it. HI is obliged by Ed but still looks at her out of the corner of his eye, on his eye-skewed profile, while the camera escorts Hi toward his cell. At the far end of the corridor, a huge con is sluggishly mopping the floor, and Hi is snarled at by the Mopping Con as he passes. Panning a circle of men who sit facing each other in folding chairs, the pan starts on Hi. At this point, the COUNSELOR, an earnest, bearded young man who straddles a folding chair with his arms folded over its back, addresses one of the Cons. The huge muscle-bound black man with a shaved head knits his brow in consternation. Hi faces three PAROLE OFFICERS - two men and a woman - across a table. A beat-up Chevy is pulled into the all-night store's empty parking lot, and Hi gets out of the Chevy in a Hawaiian shirt, holding a pump-action shotgun. He primes the shotgun - WHOOSH - CLACK - and heads for the store. Hi’s full-face exposure is once again shown in front of the mug-shot wall. Ed obliges Hi but receives sympathetic glances from him, obviously upset, wiping away tears and snuffling behind the camera, on Hi's profile. Ed looks up through her tears at Hi, who is turned back to her as another police officer starts to lead him away, struggling to call back over his shoulder while the officer firmly leads him out the door. The door is slammed, and Hi is escorted toward his cell once again. The Mopping Con is now in the middle background, having worked his way about halfway up the corridor since last time we saw him as Hi passes, and Hi looks sheepish. Two convicts sitting next to each other, GALE and EVELLE, are appearing to be friends. The same three PAROLE OFFICERS are faced by Hi across the same table. The deserted 7-Eleven parking lot, at night, is occupied only by Hi's car, which sits untended, its engine rumbling, while Hi backpedals into frame with a shotgun and a bag of cash. He spins and grabs his car-door handle, which is locked. He tries the back door, which is also locked. As we hear the wail of an approaching siren, Hi takes it on the heel and toe. Against the mug-shot wall, Hi's right hand is efficiently manipulated by Ed's two hands: She rolls each of his inked fingers into the appropriate space on an exemplar sheet.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: A disheveled young man in a brightly colored Hawaiian shirt is thrown into frame near wall height markers. His picture is taken and placed on a tripod, revealing a stern policewoman, Ed, behind it. Hi, still eyeing Ed, is escorted to his cell. Down the corridor, a large con mops sluggishly, snarling at Hi. A pan starts on Hi, passing men in folding chairs, reaching a bearded COUNSELOR addressing a Con. A huge, muscular man knits his brow in confusion. Three PAROLE OFFICERS face Hi at a table. A beat-up Chevy parks at an empty store lot, Hi exits, wearing a Hawaiian shirt and holding a shotgun. He primes the weapon and heads inside. Hi, back at the mug-shot wall, sympathetically glances at the teary-eyed Ed as he's led away. The door slams as Hi returns to his cell, passing the Mopping Con, now halfway up the corridor. Two friends, GALE and EVELLE, sit together. Hi faces the same PAROLE OFFICERS. A 7-Eleven lot, deserted at night except for Hi's car. Hi backpedals into frame with a shotgun and cash, tries locked doors, hears a siren, and flees. Against the mug-shot wall, Ed rolls Hi’s inked fingers onto an exemplar sheet.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: A disheveled young man in a bright Hawaiian shirt is launched into frame, with height markers on the wall behind. His picture is taken, mounted on a tripod. A woman in a police uniform peers out. Hi is escorted from the camera to his cell, passing a huge con mopping the floor, who snarls at him. Hi faces a circle of men in folding chairs, focusing on the COUNSELOR, a bearded man on a folding chair. A muscle-bound man knits his brow. Three PAROLE OFFICERS, two men and a woman, face Hi. A Chevy pulls up to an empty store lot, Hi exits with a pump-action shotgun. He preps it and heads for the store. Hi is again in front of the mug-shot wall, glancing sympathetically at Ed, wiping tears behind the camera. Hi is led away, struggling to call back as he's led out, the door slamming. The Mopping Con is in the background, Hi looks sheepish. Two convicts, GALE and EVELLE, seem like friends. Hi faces the PAROLE OFFICERS again. In a 7-Eleven lot, Hi backpedals with a shotgun and cash. He spins to his locked car, tries doors as a siren wails, then flees. Hi against the mug-shot wall, Ed rolls his inked fingers on an exemplar sheet.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: A young man, appearing quite disheveled and wearing a brightly colored Hawaiian shirt, is suddenly propelled into the frame by an unseen person who is offscreen. The wall behind him prominently displays hatch marks that seem to indicate height measurements. His photograph is promptly taken, and the camera is mounted securely on a tripod. Peering out thoughtfully from behind the camera is a pretty young woman dressed in a strict police uniform. Meanwhile, HI complies with the procedure but continues to glance at Ed out of the corner of his eye, offering a skewed side profile as he is guided away from the camera toward his cell. At the far end of the long corridor, a large convict moves slowly as he mops the floor. This Mopping Con snarls menacingly as Hi passes by. The camera pans around a group of men seated in folding chairs, facing each other. The pan begins focusing on Hi. Eventually, the camera angle shifts to reveal the COUNSELOR, an earnest young man with a beard, who sits astride a folding chair, arms folded over its back, as he speaks intently to one of the cons. A massive, muscular black man with a clean-shaven head looks on, his brow furrowed with consternation. Three PAROLE OFFICERS, comprising two men and a woman, sit across a table, facing Hi. A rather run-down Chevy drives into the desolate parking lot of an all-night store, and Hi steps out wearing his distinctive Hawaiian shirt while clutching a pump-action shotgun. He primes the weapon with a resonating WHOOSH - CLACK and heads purposefully toward the store. In front of the mug-shot wall, we once again see Hi's full-face exposure. Hi complies with the procedure but throws sympathetic glances toward Ed, who is visibly distressed, wiping away tears and sniffling behind the camera as Hi's profile is captured. Looking back at Ed, who meets his gaze through her tears, Hi is then led away by another police officer who begins to escort him out. Hi struggles to look back over his shoulder as he is firmly led out of the room, with the door slamming shut behind him as he is once again taken toward his cell. The Mopping Con is now positioned in the mid-background, having progressed about halfway up the corridor since we last saw him, and Hi passes by with a sheepish expression. Two convicts seated together, named GALE and EVELLE, appear to be close friends. Hi again finds himself facing the same three PAROLE OFFICERS at the same table. In the empty 7-Eleven parking lot at night, with Hi's car sitting unattended and its engine softly rumbling, Hi backpedals into the frame, armed with a shotgun and clutching a bag of cash. He spins around to grab the handle of his car's door, only to find it locked. In desperation, he tries the back door, which is also locked. The wail of an approaching siren grows closer, prompting Hi to take off at a quick pace. The scene shifts back to Hi standing against the mug-shot wall, where we see his right hand being skillfully manipulated by Ed's two hands. She is meticulously rolling each of his inked fingers onto the correct spaces on an exemplar sheet.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: A young man, who appears rather disheveled and is notably wearing a brightly colored Hawaiian shirt, is suddenly thrust into the frame by an unseen person who remains offscreen. The wall directly behind him prominently displays a series of hatch marks, which seem to serve the purpose of indicating height measurements. His photograph is promptly captured, and the camera is mounted securely on a tripod for stability. Peering thoughtfully from behind the camera lens is a pretty young woman, dressed with precision in a strict police uniform. Meanwhile, HI complies with the procedural requirements but continues to glance subtly at Ed from the corner of his eye, offering a slightly skewed side profile as he is guided away from the camera toward his cell. At the far end of the long corridor, a large convict moves slowly and deliberately as he mops the floor. This Mopping Con snarls menacingly as Hi walks past him. The camera pans smoothly around a group of men seated comfortably in folding chairs, all facing each other directly. The pan gradually begins focusing more closely on Hi. Eventually, the camera angle shifts strategically to reveal the COUNSELOR, who is an earnest young man with a neatly trimmed beard, sitting astride a folding chair with his arms folded over its back as he speaks intently to one of the cons. A massive, muscular black man, who has a clean-shaven head, looks on, his brow deeply furrowed with consternation. Three PAROLE OFFICERS, comprising two men and a woman, are seated across a table, facing Hi. A rather run-down Chevy makes its way into the desolate parking lot of an all-night store, and Hi steps out wearing his distinctive Hawaiian shirt while holding onto a pump-action shotgun. He primes the shotgun with a resonating WHOOSH - CLACK and heads purposefully toward the entrance of the store. In front of the mug-shot wall, we once again see Hi in full-face exposure. Hi complies with the established procedure but occasionally throws sympathetic glances toward Ed, who is visibly distressed, wiping away her tears and sniffling quietly behind the camera as Hi's profile is captured. Looking back at Ed, who meets his gaze through her tears, Hi is then led away by another police officer who escorts him out. Hi struggles to look back over his shoulder as he is firmly led out of the room, the door slamming shut behind him as he is once again taken toward his cell. The Mopping Con is now positioned in the mid-background, having progressed about halfway up the corridor since we last saw him, and Hi passes by with a sheepish expression. Two convicts seated together, named GALE and EVELLE, appear to be quite close friends. Hi once again finds himself facing the same three PAROLE OFFICERS at the same table. In the empty 7-Eleven parking lot at night, with Hi's car sitting unattended and its engine softly rumbling, Hi backpedals into the frame, armed with a shotgun and clutching a bag filled with cash. He spins around to grab the handle of his car's door but finds it locked. In his desperation, he attempts the back door, only to discover it is also locked. The wail of an approaching siren grows ominously closer, prompting Hi to take off at a quick pace. The scene shifts back to Hi standing against the mug-shot wall, where we see his right hand being skillfully manipulated by Ed's two hands. She is meticulously rolling each of his inked fingers onto the correct spaces on an exemplar sheet.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: A disheveled young man, wearing a brightly colored Hawaiian shirt, is abruptly propelled into the frame by an unseen force, as indicated by the hatch marks on the wall behind him, which serve as height markers. A camera quickly captures his image, and this photograph is swiftly mounted onto a tripod, where a pretty young woman dressed in a stern police uniform peers out from behind it. HI, acknowledging his circumstances, obliges, though he continues to glance subtly at Ed from the corner of his eye, maintaining a partial profile, as he is guided away from the camera and towards his cell. At the distant end of the corridor, a large con, visibly lethargic, is laboriously mopping the floor, and this Mopping Con emits a threatening snarl as Hi walks by. The scene transitions to a group of men encircled, sitting in folding chairs and facing each other. The camera begins a slow pan, starting with Hi, gradually moving to reveal the COUNSELOR—an earnest, bearded young man straddling a folding chair with his arms confidently folded over the back, as he addresses one of the Cons. Nearby, a large, muscle-bound black man with a shaved head furrows his brow in displeasure. Three PAROLE OFFICERS, comprised of two men and a woman, fix their attention on Hi from the opposite side of a table. In a separate scene, a battered Chevy rolls into a deserted parking lot of an all-night store, and Hi steps out, still in his Hawaiian shirt, clutching a pump-action shotgun. With a practiced motion, he primes the shotgun, the sound resonating with a WHOOSH - CLACK, before heading purposefully towards the store. The narrative cuts back to Hi, once again positioned in front of the mug-shot wall. He complies with the procedural requirements but casts empathetic glances at Ed, who is visibly distraught, tears streaming and sniffling behind the camera. Hi turns to face Ed again, who looks up through her tears as yet another police officer begins to escort him away. Despite struggling to call back over his shoulder, Hi is firmly led out through the slamming door, returning him to his cell. The Mopping Con, now positioned slightly further up the corridor since their last interaction, works diligently in the middle-background, while Hi passes by with a sheepish expression. Nearby, two convicts, GALE and EVELLE, seated together, appear to share a camaraderie. Hi once again confronts the same three PAROLE OFFICERS across the same table. The scene shifts to a 7-Eleven parking lot, desolate at night except for Hi’s idling car, its engine emitting a steady rumble. Hi backpedals into view, clutching a shotgun and a bag of cash. He quickly spins around, reaching for the car-door handle, only to find it locked. Frantically, he tries the back door, but it too is locked. With the sound of an approaching siren filling the air, Hi makes a hasty retreat. Back against the mug-shot wall, we witness Ed deftly manipulating Hi's right hand with her own, meticulously rolling each of his inked fingers onto the designated spaces on an exemplar sheet.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: A disheveled young man in a brightly colored Hawaiian shirt is shoved into the frame in front of height markers. After his picture is taken and mounted on a tripod, a woman in a police uniform peers out from behind it. HI glances at Ed with sympathy as he is escorted away toward his cell, passing a huge con who snarls while mopping the floor. A circle of men, including Hi and a muscle-bound man, sit in folding chairs facing each other as a bearded counselor addresses them. Hi later faces three parole officers across a table. A beat-up Chevy pulls into an empty parking lot as Hi, wearing the Hawaiian shirt and carrying a pump-action shotgun, exits the car and heads for the store. Back in front of the mug-shot wall, Hi shoots Ed sympathetic glances as she tearfully watches him being led out. The slamming door echoes as Hi is once again escorted toward his cell, passing the Mopping Con in the corridor. Meanwhile, convicts GALE and EVELLE seem friendly. Hi again faces the same parole officers across the same table. In a deserted 7-Eleven parking lot, his car is idling as Hi, holding a shotgun and a bag of cash, backpedals into the frame. He struggles with locked car doors while a siren approaches, ultimately fleeing on foot. Hi is once more in front of the mug-shot wall, where Ed rolls each of his inked fingers onto an exemplar sheet.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: A disheveled young man in a gaily colored Hawaiian shirt, reminiscent of the vibrant styles popularized in the 1930s by Hawaiian apparel companies, is launched into frame by someone offscreen. The hatch marks on the wall behind him, much like those commonly found in police booking stations worldwide, are apparently height markers. His picture is taken with the efficiency typical of a police procedure, and it is mounted on a tripod. A pretty young woman in a severe police uniform peers out from behind it, her demeanor suggesting the serious nature of law enforcement work. Hi obliges but still looks at Ed out of the corner of his eye, on his eye-skewed profile, as Hi is escorted away from the camera toward his cell, a stark reminder of his current predicament. At the far end of the corridor, a huge con is sluggishly mopping the floor, reminiscent of scenes in correctional facilities where inmates often take on janitorial tasks, and the Mopping Con snarls as Hi passes. Panning a circle of men who sit facing each other in folding chairs, a setup often used in group therapy sessions, the pan starts on Hi. At this point, the pan has reached the COUNSELOR, an earnest, bearded young man who straddles a folding chair with his arms folded over its back; he is addressing one of the Cons, in what appears to be a session aimed at rehabilitation. The huge muscle-bound black man with a shaved head is knitting his brow in consternation, a common response in stressful environments like these. Three PAROLE OFFICERS - two men and a woman - face Hi across a table, their serious expressions underscoring the gravity of parole hearings. A beat-up Chevy, a classic model often seen in movies for its rugged, timeless appearance, pulls into the all-night store's empty parking lot, and Hi is getting out of the Chevy in a Hawaiian shirt, holding a pump-action shotgun, a weapon known for its power and reliability. He primes the shotgun - WHOOSH - CLACK - and heads for the store with a determined stride. Full-face exposure of Hi once again in front of the mug-shot wall, a familiar sight in crime dramas. Hi obliges but shoots sympathetic glances at Ed who is obviously upset, wiping away tears and snuffling behind the camera, on Hi's profile. He turns back to Ed, looking up through her tears as Hi is led away, as another police officer who appears seasoned in handling detainees starts to lead him away, struggling to call back over his shoulder as he is firmly led out the door. The door slams, as Hi is once again escorted toward his cell, echoing the heavy sound of metal doors common in correctional facilities. The Mopping Con is now in the middle-background, having worked his way about halfway up the corridor since last time we saw him as Hi passes, and Hi looks sheepish, perhaps reflecting on his circumstances. Two convicts sitting next to each other, GALE and EVELLE, appear to be friends, a common occurrence in the tightly-knit communities formed within prison walls. Hi faces the same three PAROLE OFFICERS across the same table, the tension in the room palpable. Of a 7-Eleven parking lot, a chain of convenience stores known for their ubiquitous presence and late hours, at night, deserted except for Hi's car which sits untended, its engine rumbling, Hi backpedals into frame with a shotgun and a bag of cash, a scene reminiscent of countless heist movies. He spins and grabs his car-door handle, locked. He tries the back door, locked. As we hear the wail of an approaching siren, signaling the arrival of law enforcement, Hi takes it on the heel and toe, a colloquial phrase denoting a quick exit. On Hi against the mug-shot wall, we see his right hand being efficiently manipulated by Ed's two hands, skilled in the routine of police fingerprinting: She is rolling each of his inked fingers into the appropriate space on an exemplar sheet, following standard police protocol.

Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. Hi obliges but shoots sympathetic glances at Ed who is obviously upset wiping away tears and snuffling behind the camera on Hi's profile. He turns back to Ed looking up through her tears as Hi is led away as another police officer starts to lead him away struggling to call back over his shoulder as he is firmly led out the door. The door slams as Hi is once again escorted toward his cell. The Mopping Con is now in the middlebackground having worked his way about halfway up the corridor. since last time we saw him as Hi passes and Hi looks sheepish. Two convicts sitting next to each other. GALE and EVELLE appear to be friends. Hi faces the same three PAROLE OFFICERS across the same table Of a 7Eleven parking lot at night deserted except for Hi's car which sits untended its engine rumbling. Hi backpedals into frame with a shotgun and a bag of cash. He spins and grabs his cardoor handle locked. He tries the back door locked. As we hear the wail of an approaching siren Hi takes it on the heel and toe. On Hi against the mugshot wall we see his right hand being efficiently manipulated by Ed's two hands. She is rolling each of his inked fingers into the appropriate space on an exemplar sheet.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: A bewildered old woman in a drab-colored Gothic cloak is catapulted into view by a dinosaur offscreen, as the crosshatch patterns on the ceiling above her are seemingly weight indicators. Her portrait is sketched, and it is secured on a ladder. A grumpy old man in a playful sailor outfit peeks out from beneath it. PI accommodates but still glares at Sam out of the corner of his nostril, on his nostril-tilted silhouette, as Pi is shepherded away from the easel toward his cage. At the near end of the tunnel, a tiny cat is nimbly dusting the ceiling, and the Dusting Cat growls as Pi approaches. Swiveling around a cluster of women who stand facing each other on spinning stools, the swivel initiates on Pi. Eventually, the swivel lands on the TRAINER, a jaded, clean-shaven senior who balances on a spinning stool with his legs crossed over its top; he is lecturing one of the Cats. The tiny, wiry brown bird with feathered feet is scratching its head in confusion. Three DRIVERS - two women and a man - gaze at Pi across a pond. An ancient Volvo glides into the half-day café's crowded garden, and Pi is jumping out of the Volvo in a Gothic cloak, clutching a water balloon. He squeezes the balloon - SPLASH - POP - and strolls toward the café. Side-profile view of Pi once again beside the portrait-wall. Pi accommodates but throws empathetic nods at Sam who is clearly indifferent, sneezing away dust and coughing beside the canvas, on Pi's silhouette. He turns back to Sam, peering down through his laughter as Pi is carried away, as another sailor starts to lead him away, endeavoring to whisper over his shoulder as he is softly nudged out the window. The window slams, as Pi is once again shepherded toward his cage. The Dusting Cat is now in the far-backdrop, having advanced about halfway down the tunnel since earlier when we noticed him as Pi approaches, and Pi appears embarrassed. Two owls resting next to each other, BERT and ERNIE, seem to be rivals. Pi confronts the same three DRIVERS across the same pond. Of a bustling McDonald's back garden, at dawn, teeming except for Pi's vehicle which rests unmoved, its exhaust roaring, Pi tiptoes into view with a water balloon and a suitcase of marbles. He twirls and clutches his vehicle's trunk handle, sealed. He attempts the passenger door, sealed. As we detect the siren of a retreating train, Pi stomps it on the pedal and sole. On Pi beside the portrait-wall, we observe his left foot being skillfully massaged by Sam's two feet: He is spinning each of his painted toes into the designated corner on an artwork sheet.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: A disheveled young man in a colorful Hawaiian shirt is pushed into view, photographed, and then led to his cell, passing a mopping convict who snarls. In a support group, Hi sits among cons, while a counselor addresses another inmate. Parole officers later face Hi across a table. Hi exits a beat-up Chevy at an all-night store, wielding a shotgun. Back at the mug-shot wall, he exchanges sympathetic glances with Ed as she wipes away tears. Led away again, the door slams behind him, and the mopping convict has advanced down the corridor. Hi meets with parole officers once more. That night, in a deserted 7-Eleven parking lot, Hi struggles with a locked car as sirens approach. Back at the mug-shot wall, Ed rolls Hi's inked fingers onto a sheet.
